dyad.TwoBody

class dyad.TwoBody(m, q, a, e, Omega=0.0, i=0.0, omega=0.0)

A class representing the elliptical orbits of a two-body system

Represents the two orbits of a bound gravitational two-body system. The orbit of the more-massive (resp. less-massive) body is defined by its semimajor axis, \(a_{1}\) (resp. \(a_{2}\)), and eccentricity, \(e_{1}\) (resp. \(e_{2}\)). Its orientation is defined by the longitude of its ascending node, \(\Omega_{1}\) (resp. \(\Omega_{2}\)), inclination, \(i_{1}\) (resp. \(i_{2}\)), and argument of pericentre, \(\omega_{1}\) (resp. \(\omega_{2}\)). It is the case that \(a_{2} = a_{1}/q\), \(e_{2} = e_{1}\). \(\Omega_{2} = \Omega_{1}\), \(i_{2} = i_{1}\), and \(\omega_{2} = \omega_{1} + \pi\).

Parameters:
m: array-like

Mass of the more-massive body, \(m_{1}\).

q: array-like

Ratio of the less-massive star to the more-massive star, \(q := m_{2}/m_{1}\).

a: array-like

Semimajor axis of the more-massive body’s orbit, \(a_{1}\).

e: array-like

Eccentricity of the more-massive body’s orbit, \(e_{1}\).

Omega: array-like

Longitude of the ascending node of the more-massive body’s orbit, \(\Omega_{1}\).

i: array-like

Inclination of the more-massive body’s orbit, \(i_{1}\).

omega: array-like

Argument of pericentre of the more-massive body’s orbit, \(\omega_{1}\).

Examples

Scalar parameters defining a single binary system in the perifocal plane.

>>> dyad.TwoBody(1., 1., 1., 0.)

Scalar parameters defining a single orbit in the observer’s frame.

>>> dyad.TwoBody(1., 1., 1., 0., 1., 1., 1.)

Array-like parameters defining multiple orbits.

>>> m, q, a, e = [1., 1.], [1., 1.], [1., 1.], [0., 0.]
>>> orb.TwoBody(m, q, a, e)
__init__(m, q, a, e, Omega=0.0, i=0.0, omega=0.0)
